comment._content: Excellent. Health and Safety and Port Health would have a field day now.

comment.author: 41645839@N00
comment._content: I bet It wasnt "Halal" back then either, like all the Lamb from NZ Is now.
comment.authorname: Its MERRY CHRISTMAS, not happy holidays.

comment.author: 99646216@N00
comment._content: My father worked loading frozen lamb in the 1950s and 60s in NZ. It was tough, dangerous work. The carcases came on to the wharves in refrigerated railway wagons. The wharfies loaded them into nets that were craned into the ship's hold, where other wharfies stacked them. A lot of men lost fingers - the carcases were rock-hard and slippery.
